  },

    "outcomes_measured": [
      "women's empowerment",
      "political participation",
      "local civic action",
      "household well-being",
      "indebtedness",
      "economic welfare",
      "livelihood diversification",
      "skilled employment"
    ],
    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "Our results suggest that PVP has had an impact on a range of measures of economic welfare. In addition to a reduced debt burden, which is a key constraint faced by poor households in rural India, PVP also appears to have led to an increase in asset holdings of households. Importantly, our results also point to a shift in the livelihoods portfolios of households towards more skilled jobs in PVP's target areas. We find strong and significant effects on women's empowerment both within and outside the household."
    ,
    "study_design": "Propensity Score Matching (PSM)",
    "design_evidence_citation": "We evaluate the impact of a participatory livelihoods intervention-the Tamil Nadu Empowerment and Poverty Reduction (Pudhu Vaazhvu) Project (PVP) using propensity score matching methods."
    ,
    "is_review_or_policy_analysis": false,
    "publication_year": null,
    "study_conducted_year": "2005-2011",
    "sample_size": 1000000,
    "completed": true
  },
  "bonus_information": {
    "has_qualitative_components": true,
    "qualitative_methods": ["qualitative examination of mechanisms and pathways of success and failure"],
    "qualitative_evidence_citation": "This question will be the focus of a forthcoming qualitative study that will use a counterfactual design to answer these questions. While we cannot claim the same standard of causal evidence as that of evaluations that use randomisation or a discontinuity design, programme selection on observables make a strong case for a robust PSM and therefore for these results. Moreover, this evaluation is only one component of a comprehensive learning system in PVP. In particular, this retrospective evaluation will be complemented by an ongoing qualitative examination of the mechanisms and pathways of success and failure."
    ,

    "country_citation": "Against this background, we use retrospective PSM methods to evaluate a livelihoods focussed CDD project in India-the Tamil Nadu Empowerment and Poverty Reduction Project or the Pudhu Vaazhvu Project (PVP).",
    "target_population_citation": "PVP is a multi-dimensional project that works with the poorest households in the poorest regions of the Indian state of Tamil Nadu."
  }
